from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql import types as T

# SOURCE: your LLAttr Abeyance extract folder
src_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-EXTRACT/LLAttr/Abeyance_95493/"

# CASE GUID MAP: your Cases.csv (the one you maintain with legacyCaseId -> caseId GUID)
cases_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/Cases/Cases.csv"

# OUTPUT: where you want the transformed file written
out_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-TRANSFORM/CaseAbeyance/"

abey_raw = (
    spark.read.format("csv")
    .option("header", "true")
    .option("multiLine", "true")
    .option("quote", "\"")
    .option("escape", "\"")
    .option("mode", "PERMISSIVE")
    .load(src_path)
)

print("rows:", abey_raw.count())
abey_raw.printSchema()
display(abey_raw.limit(20))

def to_ts(colname: str):
    c = F.trim(F.col(colname))
    c = F.when((c.isNull()) | (c == "") | (F.lower(c) == "undefined"), F.lit(None)).otherwise(c)
    # your sample is already "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
    return F.to_timestamp(c, "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss")

abey_typed = (
    abey_raw
    .select(
        F.col("ID").cast("string").alias("legacyCaseId"),
        to_ts("2").alias("abeyanceStartDate"),
        to_ts("3").alias("abeyanceEndDate"),
        F.lit(None).cast("timestamp").alias("withdrawalDate")
    )
)

display(abey_typed)

cases_map = (
    spark.read.format("csv")
    .option("header", "true")
    .load(cases_path)
    .select(
        F.col("Case ID").cast("string").alias("legacyCaseId"),
        F.col("GUID").cast("string").alias("caseId")
    )
    .dropna(subset=["legacyCaseId", "caseId"])
    .dropDuplicates(["legacyCaseId"])
)

joined = abey_typed.join(cases_map, on="legacyCaseId", how="left")

print("rows total:", joined.count())
print("rows with caseId:", joined.filter(F.col("caseId").isNotNull()).count())

display(joined.filter(F.col("caseId").isNull()).select("legacyCaseId").limit(50))

case_abeyance_ready = (
    joined
    .filter(F.col("caseId").isNotNull())     # only load mapped cases
    .select(
        "abeyanceStartDate",
        "abeyanceEndDate",
        "withdrawalDate",
        "caseId"
    )
    .dropDuplicates(["caseId"])              # because caseId is @unique
)

print("final rows:", case_abeyance_ready.count())
display(case_abeyance_ready.limit(100))
